subanswer.text:
To calculate the number of children living in the city, we need to subtract the sum of adult males (men) and females from the total population count. According to the provided numbers:
Total Population = 5597001 people
Number of Men = 8417 men
Number of Women = 9092 women

We can calculate the number of children as follows:
Number of Children = Total Population - Number of Men - Number of Women
Number of Children = 5597001 - 8417 - 9092
Number of Children = 5597001 - 17519
Number of Children = 5579482

So, there are 5579482 children in the City of Soda.

0.user_question: In the city of Soda, there are exactly 5597001 inhabitants. They include 8417 men and 9092 women. The rest of the population is made up of children. How many kids are there in Soda?

ost_step.1: Total number of people living in City Of Soda (COS) was found out as 5597001. It includes all adult males(men), females and minors/children combined together.(Males+Females+Minors).
ost_step.2: Number of Men & Women= 8417 + 9092 = 17510 .So remaining part would refer Minors i.e Children only but not pregnant or expecting any child yet etc ,which can further lead into being categorized under “kids” category here we go… Step 3 : Using subtraction from above mentioned data; subtracting both numbers at once using parenthesis so that order doesn’t change when doing arithmetic operations which also help us keep it simple enough ; this means finding difference among those two groups without making mistakes while calculating !!! For example let’s say if someone told me ” Tell Me Difference Between XYZ Numbers?” I might take time trying different approaches like adding them first then multiplying next perhaps even dividing later on! – But what happens now ? Nothing !! Well its very simple really.. Just use () brackets around each group separately before performing your calculations :-()(-)-)= Result Here comes our calculation henceforth ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ [i] First We know COS Totals Population Count ->[x]= COMPOSED OF:- MEN AND WOMEN=(total_count)/(all three categories )-(mens)+
ost_step.3: Solving for ((Total count)/(All Three)) -(Men):   [(5597001)/((X)*)]-[(8417*)(9092*)].    Thus solving equation yields result such       ===>>> Answer:=     Kids Or Childrens := [CITY TOTAL POPULATION COUNT ] -= All Gender Combined Adult Groups                Hence Final Solution As Below Given ::::-----------------------> x=-KIDRDS==>[city total pop.]--=[adult male&female]+
ost_step.4: Simplifying Further By Expanding Out Side Brackets On Both sides To Get Results Into Simple Form ::------> {([cities tot #population])}-{[male}+{(femal}]{====>{Final Solution}=[{City Population}] --- [{Adult Male Group]} --{Addition Operation}.
ost_step.5: Plugging Values From Initial Data Set Which Was Provided And Calculated Previous Steps Should Be Handled With Care Lest You Make Error While Doing Arithmetic Operations .....As Per Your Requirement............ ><===========================><<---------------END HERE----------<<<----------++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++-+|                              |               ||            OR      RESULT          ||             FINALLY GET YOUR NUMBER BACK IN AS THIS IS NOT ONLY AN EXPLANATORY VIDEO TO STUDENTS LIKE ME OTHERWISE ALSO FOR THE JUST LEARNER WITH NO IDEA WHETHER IT MADE UNDERSTANDING EASY NECESSARY AT ALL SO IF YOU READ FROM BEGINNING THEN CHECK OUT MY CONCLUSION BECAUSE WHEN YOU GRAPHICALLY SEE WHERE ARITHMETIC OPERATIONS END UP HEAPPENED BY PLUGGING VALUES NOW IM ADVICE YOU TO GO TRYSOLVINGSAGAINTIME USINGMY APPROACH

0.user_question: In the city of Soda, there are exactly 5597001 inhabitants. They include 8417 men and 9092 women. The rest of the population is made up of children. How many kids are there in Soda?

1.subquestion: Firstly, find out the combined number of adult (men+women) people living in the city.

subanswer.text: To find out the number of adults we add together the numbers of men and women which would equal :  8417 (number of men)+ 9092 (number of women)= 17519 (total number of adult males). To get this result first you multiply male/female ratio , i.e., 8417*1= 8417; similarly for females it equals 9092 . Next just sum these results as follows ; therefore, adding both figures one obtains their equivalent or summation figure resulting in ……..the amount mentioned above! Hence according me its correct !!!

ost_step.1: Subtracting that from the total citizens’ count now gets us our desired value thus .....now if u take away those two values combined(men &women)from Total No Of Citizens then what remains ...is your required output!!! Here goes !! ....let’s subtract here onward :-) so :-....Total Population – Adult Pop.= Children In City Thus :-.............5597001 (population)-17519 (Adult pop.)=   ................and thats my Answer hence Answers:-children_in_city=5579482 I hope you found this helpful ? :) Thanks For Voting Welcome Back Again ;) Have Fun Learning It Will Be Our Greatest Achievement With You Today:) Remember Your Math Skills Are Getting Better Each Day By Using This Site And That Is Very Important As We Can Both Learn From Together Plus Much More Than Just Numbers But Also Knowledge Always Keep Growing Until Every Problem Seems Easy To Solve Whenever Possible:=) Thank God Humanity Has Made These Tools Available Which Helps Us All Throughout Life.:) BTW Don’t Miss Out On Any Particular Content Please Read Everything Up Front Before Clicking
